articles.title: A Day of Discovery at the Mangrove Forest
articles.author: Ms. Nisanasala Jayasundara
articles.summary: Grade 6 students from Maris Stella College, Negombo, explored mangrove ecosystems through hands-on workshops and field sessions, learning about conservation and environmental stewardship.
articles.content:
A group of curious minds from Maris Stella College, Negombo, recently embarked on an unforgettable journey to the NARA Kadolkale Regional Research Center. Grade 6 students and their two teachers dived deep into the secrets of mangrove ecosystems through engaging workshops and hands-on field sessions conducted by Ms. Nisanasala Jayasundara, Scientist, NARA.

The educational program focused on mangrove adaptations, species identification, and the critical role these ecosystems play in coastal protection. Students learned about the unique survival mechanisms that allow mangroves to thrive in saltwater environments and their importance in biodiversity conservation.

Through interactive sessions, the young learners discovered the various threats facing mangrove ecosystems and the legal frameworks in place to protect them. The program emphasized the importance of environmental stewardship and inspired the next generation to become champions of conservation.
key_points: Students learned about mangrove adaptations and survival mechanisms
Hands-on identification of true mangrove species
Education on conservation threats and legal frameworks
Inspiring the next generation of environmental stewards

articles.title: NARA and NAQDA Join Forces for New Research Centre
articles.author: Prof. Sanath Hettiarachchi
articles.summary: Marine Species Breeding and Aquaculture Research Centre established through strategic partnership between NARA and NAQDA, focusing on marine ornamental fish and sustainable aquaculture practices.
articles.content:
The Marine Species Breeding and Aquaculture Research Centre has been established through a groundbreaking partnership between NARA and NAQDA. The MoU was signed by Prof. Sanath Hettiarachchi, Chairman of NARA, and Mr. Kithsiri Dharmapriya, Chairman of NAQDA, marking a significant milestone in Sri Lanka's aquaculture development.

This three-year initiative, beginning August 2025, will focus on the breeding and cultivation of marine ornamental fish, shrimp, corals, crabs, lobsters, and sea cucumbers. Special emphasis will be placed on breeding green mussels (Perna viridis), a species with high commercial value and nutritional benefits.

The center will also conduct crucial research on live feeds and water quality management, essential components for successful aquaculture operations. The facility aims to support entrepreneurs and university students through training programs and technology transfer initiatives.
key_points: Focus on marine ornamental fish, shrimp, corals, crabs, lobsters, and sea cucumbers
Special emphasis on breeding green mussels (Perna viridis)
Research on live feeds and water quality management
Support for entrepreneurs and university students

si.title: NARA සහ NAQDA එක්ව නව ගවේෂණ මධ්‍යස්ථානයක් පිහිටුවයි
si.summary: NARA සහ NAQDA අතර උසස් හවුල්කාරිත්වයකින් සාගර ආලංකාර මීන් හා තිරසාර ජලකර්මාන්ත ක්‍රියාපටිපාටියන් මත අවධානය යොමු කරන සාගර ජීවීන් ඉන්කුබේෂන් සහ ජලකර්මාන්ත පර්යේෂණ මධ්‍යස්ථානයක් පිහිටුවා ඇත.
si.author: පාඨ. සැනත් හෙට්ටිආරච්චි · NARA සභාපති
key_points: සාගර ආලංකාර මීන්, ඉස්සල්, කොරල්, කැංකරු, ලොබ්ස්ටර් සහ කිඹුලා වැනි ප්‍රජාවන් මත අවධානය යොමු කිරීම
උසස් වෙළඳ වටිනාකමක් සහ පෝෂණ ගුණ තත්වයක් ඇති පේර්නා විරිඩිස් හරිත මුසුල් පශ්චාත් කර්මාන්තය සඳහා ප්‍රමුඛතාවය
සාර්ථක ජලකර්මාන්ත මෙහෙයුම් සඳහා සජීවී ආහාර සහ ජල ගුණාත්මය කළමනාකරණය පිළිබඳ පර්යේෂණ
ව්‍යාපාරිකයින් සහ විශ්වවිද්‍යාල ශිෂ්‍යයන් සඳහා පුහුණු වැඩසටහන් හා තාක්ෂණ හුවමාරු සහය
2025 අගෝස්තු සිට ආරම්භ වන වසර තුනක උපායමක්

ta.title: NARA–NAQDA கூட்டு ஆராய்ச்சி மையம் திறக்கப்பட்டது
ta.summary: NARA மற்றும் NAQDA ஆகியவற்றின் மூலோபாய கூட்டாண்மையால் கடல் அலங்கார மீன் மற்றும் நிலையான அக்வாகல்சர் பயிற்சிகளில் கவனம் செலுத்தும் கடல் உயிரின இனப்பெருக்க மற்றும் நீர்வள தொழில்நுட்ப ஆராய்ச்சி மையம் நிறுவப்பட்டுள்ளது.
ta.author: பேராசிரியர் சணத் ஹெட்டியாரச்சி · NARA தலைவர்
key_points: கடல் அலங்கார மீன், இறால், பவளம், நண்டு, லாப்ஸ்டர் மற்றும் கடல் வெள்ளைகளில் கவனம்
உயர் வர்த்தக மதிப்புள்ள பச்சை முசெல் (Perna viridis) இனப்பெருக்கத்திற்கு முன்னுரிமை
வெற்றிகரமான அக்வாகல்சருக்கான உயிர்த்தீவனம் மற்றும் நீர்தர மேலாண்மை ஆராய்ச்சி
தொழில் முனைவோர் மற்றும் பல்கலைக்கழக மாணவர்களுக்கு பயிற்சி மற்றும் தொழில்நுட்ப பரிமாற்ற ஆதரவு
2025 ஆகஸ்ட் முதல் துவங்கும் மூன்று ஆண்டு முன்முயற்சி

articles.title: National Workshop on Fishery Management Inventory (FMInv) – Sri Lanka
articles.author: NARA Research Team
articles.summary: NARA hosted international workshop to strengthen sustainable fisheries management in Sri Lanka with experts from FAO, BOBP-IGO, and ICAR-CIFE.
articles.content:
NARA successfully hosted the National Workshop on Fishery Management Inventory from August 4-6, 2025, bringing together national and international fisheries experts, scientists, and fishing community representatives. The workshop was facilitated by renowned international experts from FAO, BOBP-IGO, and ICAR-CIFE.

The workshop focused on three critical fishery management areas: sea cucumber fishery in Northern Sri Lanka, Puttalam Lagoon fishery management plans, and small pelagic fishery management in the Southwest coast. These sessions provided valuable insights into sustainable fishing practices and ecosystem-based management approaches.

Participants engaged in detailed discussions about current challenges, best practices, and innovative solutions for sustainable fisheries management. The workshop resulted in comprehensive action plans for each fishery sector, emphasizing community participation and scientific evidence-based decision making.
key_points: International facilitators from FAO, BOBP-IGO, and ICAR-CIFE
Focus on sea cucumber fishery in Northern Sri Lanka
Small pelagic fishery in Southwest coast management

articles.title: NARA with Elcome: Transforming Sri Lanka's Fishing Industry
articles.author: Technology Integration Team
articles.summary: Partnership with Elcome International to enhance maritime safety and fleet management through cutting-edge Starlink technology and real-time monitoring systems.
articles.content:
Elcome International LLC, a leading maritime services company, met with NARA officials to discuss revolutionary maritime technology services that could transform Sri Lanka's fisheries industry through their advanced Starlink customer portal.

The partnership will introduce real-time weather updates and navigation charts, enabling fishermen to make informed decisions about their fishing expeditions. The system will also provide seawater temperature and dissolved oxygen measurements, crucial data for optimizing fishing locations and catch quality.

Additionally, the technology includes live vessel tracking and CCTV monitoring for enhanced safety, emergency communication and medical support capabilities, and e-commerce facilities for direct buyer communication. A prototype model will be tested on selected multi-day boats to demonstrate the technology's effectiveness.
key_points: Real-time weather updates and navigation charts
Seawater temperature and dissolved oxygen measurements
Live vessel tracking and CCTV monitoring
E-commerce facilities for direct buyer communication
Prototype model for selected multi-day boats

articles.title: Sustainable Waste Management Partnership with MAS Active
articles.author: Environmental Management Team
articles.summary: MAS Active Linea Intimo donates color-coded garbage bins to promote sustainable waste management practices at NARA facilities.
articles.content:
NARA received 48 color-coded garbage bins from MAS Active Linea Intimo as part of the comprehensive Sustainable Waste Management Project, enabling proper waste segregation and disposal practices across all NARA facilities.

The donation includes bins with a sophisticated color-coded system: green for organic waste, blue for paper and cardboard, orange for plastics and metal, and red for glass and hazardous materials. This system aligns perfectly with the Clean Sri Lanka Concept and demonstrates strong corporate social responsibility.

As part of the partnership, MAS representatives were given comprehensive tours of NARA's laboratories and research vessels to understand the organization's environmental research capabilities and commitment to sustainability.
key_points: 48 bins with color-coded system (green, blue, orange, red)
Proper separation of organic waste, paper, plastics, and glass
Alignment with Clean Sri Lanka Concept
Laboratory and research vessel tours for MAS representatives

articles.title: NARA Commemorates World Mangrove Day
articles.author: Conservation Team
articles.summary: Awareness workshop with local and international participants to enhance understanding of mangrove ecosystems and conservation efforts.
articles.content:
An impactful awareness workshop was held at NARA Kadolkale Regional Research Center in celebration of World Mangrove Day, bringing together local and international participants including representatives from Korean Maritime and Ocean University.

The workshop covered comprehensive mangrove ecosystem identification and the critical importance of these coastal guardians. Participants learned about the ecological and socio-economic significance of mangroves, including their role in coastal protection, carbon sequestration, and biodiversity conservation.

The program highlighted current threats to mangrove ecosystems and the legal protection frameworks in place. Participants engaged in hands-on restoration activities in Negombo Lagoon, demonstrating practical conservation techniques and fostering international collaboration in environmental protection.
key_points: Current threats and legal protection frameworks
Hands-on restoration activities in Negombo Lagoon

articles.title: Udawalawa Reservoir Fishing Community Capacity Enhancement
articles.author: Community Development Team
articles.summary: Three-day workshop targeting unemployed women in fishing community for value-added fishery product development and entrepreneurship.
articles.content:
NARA scientists conducted a comprehensive three-day workshop targeting unemployed women from the local fishing community, focusing on value-added fishery products and entrepreneurship skills development.

Participants received hands-on training in preparing innovative seaweed products including jelly and pudding, as well as traditional smoked fish and modern fish patty preparation techniques. The workshop also covered essential marketing strategies and entrepreneurship education to help women establish sustainable self-employment opportunities.

The program included plans for a demonstration at the popular Udawalawa Elephant Orphanage, providing participants with direct market exposure and networking opportunities with tourists and local businesses.
key_points: Training on seaweed products (jelly and pudding)
Smoked fish and fish patty preparation
Planned demonstration at Udawalawa Elephant Orphanage

articles.title: Ecosystem Approach to Fisheries Management Workshop
articles.author: BOBP-IGO Collaboration Team
articles.summary: BOBP-IGO and NARA collaborate on EAFM capacity-building workshop for sustainable fisheries management across multiple agencies.
articles.content:
The Bay of Bengal Programme Inter-Governmental Organization (BOBP-IGO), in collaboration with NARA, conducted a comprehensive capacity-building workshop on the Ecosystem Approach to Fisheries Management (EAFM).

The workshop brought together multi-agency participation from key institutions across Sri Lanka, focusing on practical case studies from Puttalam Lagoon and Jaffna Lagoon. Participants learned to integrate ecological, social, and governance aspects into fisheries management decisions.

Expert guidance from regional specialists provided insights into best practices and innovative approaches to sustainable fisheries management. The workshop significantly advanced ecosystem-based fisheries management understanding and implementation capacity among participating institutions.
key_points: Focus on Puttalam Lagoon and Jaffna Lagoon case studies
Integration of ecological, social, and governance aspects

articles.title: NARA Partners with Dialog for Real-time Fish Hotspot Alerts
articles.author: Digital Innovation Team
articles.summary: Partnership with Dialog Axiata to provide SMS-based fishing ground advisories through the trilingual Sayuru platform.
articles.content:
NARA and Dialog Axiata signed a groundbreaking agreement to disseminate potential fishing ground advisories through Dialog's innovative trilingual Sayuru fishing app, delivering real-time tuna location information via SMS to registered fishermen.

This partnership leverages NARA's 16+ years of fish forecasting experience, providing daily updates on tuna populations and optimal fishing locations. The service helps fishermen optimize their fuel costs and increase catch efficiency through scientific data-driven advisories.

The trilingual platform ensures accessibility for fishermen from different linguistic backgrounds, making vital fishing information available in Sinhala, Tamil, and English.
key_points: Integration with Dialog's Sayuru fishing app

articles.title: NARA Kowul Wasanthaya - 2025
articles.author: Cultural Committee
articles.summary: Annual Sinhala and Tamil New Year celebration fostering cultural unity and community spirit at NARA.
articles.content:
NARA celebrated the traditional Sinhala and Tamil New Year with vibrant cultural festivities and active staff participation. The celebration embodied the spirit of renewal and unity that characterizes this important cultural milestone.

Staff members from all divisions participated in traditional games, cultural performances, and community building activities. The event strengthened bonds among colleagues and celebrated Sri Lanka's rich cultural heritage.

articles.title: Scripps Grants Modern Multi-media Projector to NARA
articles.author: International Relations Team
articles.summary: Scripps Institute provides advanced presentation equipment to enhance NARA's research capabilities and international collaboration.
articles.content:
NARA received a state-of-the-art multi-media projector from the prestigious Scripps Institute as part of the successful completion of the ADB-Scripps collaborative project, significantly enhancing research presentation capabilities.

This modern equipment will facilitate better knowledge sharing during scientific conferences, workshops, and training programs. The donation represents the strong partnership between NARA and Scripps Institute in advancing marine science research and education.

The projector will be utilized in NARA's main conference hall for national and international scientific presentations, training sessions, and collaborative research meetings.
key_points: Advanced presentation equipment from Scripps Institute

articles.title: Chamber of Marine Industry Partnership for Environmental Education
articles.author: Education Partnership Team
articles.summary: NARA and Chamber of Marine Industry collaborate on environmental education for future generations through innovative youth programs.
articles.content:
NARA initiated strategic dialogue with the Chamber of Marine Industry Sri Lanka to build robust private sector partnerships for creating environmentally conscious future citizens through expanded Aqua Club and Junior Scientists programs.

The partnership focuses on developing the next generation of marine industry professionals while instilling strong environmental values. The collaboration will offer globally recognized certifications and hands-on learning experiences in marine science and conservation.

This initiative represents a significant step toward integrating private sector expertise with NARA's educational mission, ensuring sustainable workforce development for Sri Lanka's marine sector.
key_points: Aqua Club and Junior Scientists program expansion

articles.title: Livelihood Development Through Mangrove-based Products
articles.author: Livelihood Development Team
articles.summary: Workshop on innovative mangrove-based products for women's livelihood enhancement in fishing communities.
articles.content:
NARA conducted an innovative awareness workshop focused on developing groundbreaking mangrove-based products to support livelihood enhancement and empower women in fishing communities.

The workshop introduced participants to creating herbal tea from Acanthus illicifolius, a mangrove species with medicinal properties, and extracting natural dyes from Rhizophora mucronata and Xylocarpus granatum for textile and craft applications.

Seventy participants from various fishing communities received field exposure for species identification and hands-on training in product development. The program specifically emphasized women's empowerment by providing sustainable income generation opportunities through mangrove resource utilization.
key_points: Mangrove dye extraction from Rhizophora mucronata and Xylocarpus granatum

articles.title: Norway-Sri Lanka Bilateral Project Phase III Inception
articles.location: Ministry of Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean Resources
articles.author: International Projects Team
articles.summary: Launch of Phase III (2025-2028) of Norway-Sri Lanka bilateral project for sustainable marine resource management.
articles.content:
The inception meeting for Norway-Sri Lanka Bilateral Project Phase III was successfully held, marking the launch of an ambitious 2025-2028 project timeline focused on strengthening sustainable management of marine resources through enhanced collaboration with Norwegian institutions.

This phase emphasizes collaboration with the prestigious Institute of Marine Research Norway, bringing world-class expertise to Sri Lanka's marine sector. The project focuses on sustainable marine resource management practices and positions Sri Lanka as a regional leader in responsible fisheries management.

With Norwegian government support through NORAD, this partnership represents one of the most significant international collaborations in Sri Lanka's marine research history, promising transformative impacts on the sector.
key_points: Collaboration with Institute of Marine Research Norway
Regional leadership in responsible fisheries management

articles.title: Addressing Ornamental Aquatic Fish Sector Challenges
articles.author: Industry Support Team
articles.summary: NARA meets with ornamental fish exporters to address quarantine and market challenges in the industry.
articles.content:
NARA organized a crucial meeting with the Association of Live Tropical Fish Exporters to discuss pressing challenges in quarantine procedures, market demand, and export processes for Sri Lanka's ornamental fish sector.

Discussions centered on streamlining quarantine procedures to reduce mortality rates and processing times. NARA scientists presented research on natural plant alternatives to antimicrobials, offering sustainable solutions for fish health management.

The meeting resulted in collaborative plans for optimizing export processes, enhancing market competitiveness, and establishing research partnerships to address industry-specific challenges through scientific innovation.

articles.title: NARA Celebrates 43rd Anniversary
articles.author: Anniversary Committee
articles.summary: Simple and meaningful ceremony marking NARA's 43 years of aquatic research excellence and environmental stewardship.
articles.content:
NARA celebrated its 43rd anniversary with a simple yet meaningful Buddhist ceremony including Mal Pooja Pinkama and Dhamma speech, reflecting on the organization's four decades of contributions to Sri Lanka's aquatic resource management.

The ceremony honored past and present employees who have dedicated their careers to advancing marine science and protecting Sri Lanka's aquatic resources. The celebration emphasized NARA's role as a steward of the nation's blue economy and marine biodiversity.

The anniversary marked not just institutional achievements but reaffirmed NARA's commitment to future aquatic resource management and sustainable development of Sri Lanka's marine sector.
key_points: Recognition of past and present employees
Commitment to future aquatic resource management

articles.title: NARA & LB Finance Partner for Biodiversity and Livelihoods
articles.author: Conservation Partnership Team
articles.summary: Partnership to create artificial fish habitats and coral replanting for biodiversity enhancement and community tourism.
articles.content:
NARA and LB Finance signed a transformative MoU for a pilot project to create artificial fish habitats and replant corals in Kaisawella, Dondra, combining marine conservation with innovative community-based tourism opportunities.

The project focuses on creating artificial habitat structures to enhance fish breeding grounds while simultaneously implementing coral replanting initiatives to restore damaged reef ecosystems. This dual approach maximizes ecological benefits while creating sustainable economic opportunities.

The community-based management approach ensures local stakeholder involvement in conservation efforts while supporting the marine ornamental fish trade through sustainable practices and eco-tourism development.
key_points: Artificial habitat creation for fish breeding

articles.title: Enhancing the Ornamental Aquatic Plant Industry
articles.author: Plant Industry Development Team
articles.summary: Collaborative meeting to address challenges and opportunities in Sri Lanka's ornamental aquatic plant sector.
articles.content:
NARA organized a strategic meeting with ornamental aquatic plant exporters and NAQDA to discuss market demand analysis, production capabilities, and export process improvements for Sri Lanka's growing ornamental plant sector.

Discussions focused on market demand analysis and species requirements from international buyers, along with strategies for utilizing NAQDA's tissue culture laboratory facilities for scaled production. NARA's expertise in plant tissue culture protocol development offers significant potential for industry growth.

The meeting resulted in commitments for government process streamlining and enhanced industry stakeholder collaboration, positioning Sri Lanka as a competitive player in the global ornamental aquatic plant market.
key_points: Market demand analysis and species requirements
NARA plant tissue culture protocol development
